channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The New York Times’ David Brooks Is Either Stupid Or Dishonest. He Should Be Fired Either Way
item.description: Democrats are doing everything to explain their election wipeout but admit that Joe Biden’s presidency and all of the party’s disastrous policies were...

item.title: Voters Everywhere Are Yelling, ‘I’m Mad As Hell and Not Going to Take It Anymore!’
item.description: For repudiated parties around the world, isn’t it time for a little introspection?

item.title: Escaping the Benchmark Trap: A Guide for Smarter Investing
item.description: Is it time to eschew the benchmark trap in favor of Warren Buffett's rule, "Don't lose capital?"

item.title: Sen. Sanders says he is looking forward to Trump 'fulfilling his promise' on credit card interest rates

item.title: Biden Promotes DEI-Pushing Air Force Officials On His Way Out The Door
item.description: Two Air Force officers promoted by Joe Biden have openly promoted DEI in their capacities as military officials.

item.title: Book Review: The M&A Failure Trap
item.description: Massive M&A deals make headlines but too rarely make money for stockholders.

item.title: Trump picks Karoline Leavitt to serve as White House press secretary
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump has chosen Karoline Leavitt to serve as White House press secretary for his upcoming administration.

item.title: Trump’s Foreign Policy Agenda Must Start By Undoing Four Years Of Global Insolvency
item.description: American resources are limited. We must address the greatest threats from large, powerful countries like China first, then everyone else.

item.title: Is soy good or bad for you? We asked experts and here’s the verdict
item.description: People have long been told to avoid soy, but experts say it could be one of the best foods for you.

item.title: Rep. Jared Golden comes out ahead through Maine's ranked choice voting, but there may be a recount
item.description: Democratic Rep. Jared Golden came out ahead in the congressional race through Maine's ranked choice system, election officials said Friday.

item.title: Democrat wins House race to retain seat in California's 21st district
item.description: Democratic Rep. Jim Costa was re-elected to serve another term in California's 21st Congressional District after over a week of counting ballots.

item.title: To stop the next Ticketmaster-style meltdown, Congress must pass the TICKET Act before the buzzer—Sports Fans Coalition
item.description: HR 3950, the Transparency In Charges for Key Events Ticketing Act, has been in the making for two years.

item.title: RFK Jr. and Our Big, Fat Controversies
item.description: I’m pretty sure that Kennedy is a crank, generally. But he’s not wrong when it comes to some basic arguments about food and nutrition in America.

item.title: Tyson Vs. Paul Is The Post-Election, Feel-Good Slugfest America Needs
item.description: Friday's Mike Tyson vs. Jake Paul fight offers Americans a short break from the insanity of U.S. politics.

item.title: The Week: Trump Staffs Up
item.description: Plus: Pope Francis encourages the Saints.

item.title: Trump names Karoline Leavitt as youngest ever White House press secretary
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump on Friday named Karoline Leavitt, his campaign press secretary, to serve as his White House press secretary.

item.title: The Tyranny of IRR: A Reality Check on Private Market Returns

item.title: The No. 1 thing you can do to help your kids become ‘fully functioning, successful adults’
item.description: The single best gift you could ever give your kid, says psychologist Dr. Becky Kennedy, "is the ability to handle hard things.”

item.title: Pence says he opposes RFK Jr.’s nomination for HHS secretary because of his stance on abortion
item.description: Former Vice President Mike Pence said he opposes Robert F. Kennedy, Jr.'s nomination for the Department of Health and Human Services secretary.

item.title: Judge blocks Biden administration's rule to expand overtime pay for millions
item.description: A federal judge in Texas has blocked a new rule from the Biden administration that would have expanded access to overtime pay to millions more salarie...

item.title: Barcelona legend Gerard Piqué thinks he’s created the perfect sport for Gen Z’s falling attention span
item.description: The Kings League, which Piqué calls “football with a video game,” is building a massive youth-based audience.

item.title: Arnold Schwarzenegger’s 3 tips for staying active as you age: ‘Don’t think, just get going’
item.description: Exercise isn’t supposed to be a luxury for older adults, but it can be hard to get moving again. The “Terminator” star is back to help.

item.title: No, the Left Can’t Create a New Joe Rogan
item.description: If it did, he’d probably be a bore.

item.title: A Guide for Investment Analysts: Working with Historical Market Data
item.description: Interested in working with older historical data? Pitfalls lurk for the unwary.

item.title: Will Democrats Now Become Born-Again Federalists?
item.description: Red-state arguments against federal-government overreach will now be dusted off in service of blue-state priorities. Good.
